data.name: Punk Rope
data.about:
Punk Rope is a passionate leader in the fight against sedentary living and childhood obesity. We believe that getting fit should be fun and that all people, regardless of size, shape, income, race, religious affiliation, or sexual orientation should have the opportunity to participate in recreational activities that promote health and joy. 

Founded in New York City in 2004 by personal trainer, Tim Haft, Punk Ropeâs mission is fourfold:
1) To promote and share the joy of play through classes, special events, educational materials, and live workshops.
2) To encourage the pursuit of fitness and healthy living through intense, but safe, games and activities.
3) To build community by creating and promoting a variety of social, cultural, and charitable events and activities.
4) To share our love of music and encourage the support and appreciation of the artists, which provide a feast for our ears.

In addition to offering our signature Punk Rope classes, Punk Rope, Inc. is the creator of Punk Rope for Kids, a rope-jumping program for children in grades K-12; Beastanetics, a high-intensity bodyweight workout for those seeking to take their fitness level to new heights; the Punk Rope Games, an annual playful competition; and a variety of educational workshops, which allow us to share what weâve learned about play and fitness. We hope our legacy will be one of serving the greater good and putting smiles on the faces of our students, as well as some lean muscle on their bodies.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Offered since 2005, nearly 1000 fitness professionals and enthusiasts have attended the Punk Rope Workshop. The feedback has been incredibly positive and extremely humbling for Punk Rope founders, Tim Haft and Shana Brady, who, by the way, co-lead the majority of the workshops.

The 7-hour workshop covers a wide range of material, which is why it appeals to group exercise instructors, personal trainers, PE teachers, and fitness enthusiasts. 

Topics include: strength training for rope jumping, rope jumping mechanics, the 4-step method of rope jumping, basic and intermediate steps, resting moves, partner jumping, long rope, creative calisthenics, fitness games, partner drills, relay races, warming up and cooling down for rope jumping, music, class structure, and using themes for classes. 

During the workshop, participants will also have the opportunity to take part in a Punk Rope themed demonstration class.

Successful completion of the Punk Rope Workshop and acceptance of the Punk Rope Instructor Agreement leads to a lifetime Punk Rope certificate.

data.name: American Academy of Personal Training (AAPT)
data.about:
The American Academy of Personal Training is a privately owned, nationally and internationally accredited, state licensed school located in New York, NY and Boston, MA. We are the first and only nationally accredited school for Personal Trainers in the U.S. We offer a comprehensive education and assessment based program designed to create highly knowledgeable and successful Personal Trainers in the fitness industry.

The course is a total of 300-hours with 150 hours of academic study in the classroom and 150 hours of practical hands-on training in our gym facility. Students develop the knowledge and skills essential to prescribing exercises and directing fitness programs for active and sedentary individuals. Students will gain a deep understanding of nutrition, kinesiology, exercise physiology, anatomy, biomechanics, training adaptations, business, and program design that far exceed the current standards in the industry. 

AAPT graduates represent a new breed of successful career Personal Trainers who are making a profound impact on the health and fitness community.

data.name: International Tennis Performance Association (iTPA)
data.about:
iTPA is recognized by the American Council on Exercise as a Continuing Education Specialist. 

iTPA is recognized by the Board of Certification, Inc. to offer continuing education for Certified Athletic Trainers.

International Tennis Performance Association (iTPA) is the worldwide education and certification organization for trainers, coaches and specialists who have a passion for tennis-specific performance enhancement and injury prevention. 

Through quality evidence-based education combined with accurate, professional credentialing, the iTPA is the leader in tennis-specific performance, education and certification for individuals and organizations working within the tennis industry.  The iTPA will continue to be the evidence-based authority in tennis promoting the professionalism and expertise of iTPA-certified members while helping to improve the health, safety and performance of tennis athletes worldwide.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
TPT is the Level 1 certification targeted at those wanting to enter the profession, tennis coaches who also perform the physical training with their players or those fitness or other professionals looking to add tennis-specific initiatives to their current training/specialist offerings.

TPT focuses on basic, evidence-based tennis-specific training research provided in a practical manner which builds your knowledge and skills when working with tennis athletes of all ages and levels. The applicant will learn tennis-specific sport science information with assessments, drills & exercises to improve performance and reduce injuries in the tennis athlete. The program educates in 14 areas of competencies including an extensive examination to ensure mastery of the tennis-specific training information. All materials were either written or reviewed by leading sports medicine or sports science experts.

attrs.label: Prerequisite
attrs.value: Must be over 18 years of age and have a current CPR, AED, or First Aid Certificate

This certification is essential for any professional working with tennis athletes of all levels.

Applicant will learn comprehensive tennis-specific sport science information with hundreds of assessments, drills & exercises to improve performance and reduce injuries in the tennis athlete. data.name: Muscle Activation Techniquesâ¢ (MATâ¢)
data.about:
MAT IS:

--A REVOLUTIONARY APPROACH TO THE ASSESSMENT AND CORRECTION OF MUSCULAR IMBALANCES, JOINT INSTABILITY, AND LIMITATIONS IN RANGE OF MOTION WITHIN THE HUMAN BODY.

--A NON-INVASIVE TECHNIQUE, DESIGNED TO BALANCE THE MUSCULAR SYSTEM OF PEOPLE OF ALL AGES.

--A UNIQUE SYSTEMATIC FORMAT USED TO âJUMPSTARTâ THE MUSCLES IN ORDER FOR THEM TO FUNCTION WITH MAXIMUM EFFICIENCY.



WHO IS MATâ¢ FOR?

MATâ¢ is effective for EVERYONE from elite athletes to rehabilitation patients, and anyone in between. MATâ¢ has been successfully implemented with professional athletes (NFL, NBA, NHL, CFL, PGA, etc.) in clinical rehabilitative, personal training environments, and countless other settings.

WHAT CAN MATâ¢ DO FOR YOU?

Muscle Activation Techniquesâ¢ is a specific and unique process for evaluating an individualâs ability to produce efficient muscle contraction. Loss of muscle contraction results in a decreased range of motion, and therefore decreased physical performance.

Range of motion testing can indicate which muscles have decreased contractibility, and precise forces are applied to restore that muscleâs efficiency. The MATâ¢ Certified Specialist is trained and certified to perform several force application techniques that can restore function and strengthen weak muscles.

In no time at all, you will be performing your daily activities with ease, whether that means throwing 100 yard passes or walking up the stairs!

SEE FOR YOURSELF

See for yourself what MATâ¢ can do for you to decrease muscular imbalances and address muscle pain. Call 303-745-4270 Ext. 1 to schedule your appointment today at our Denver World Headquarters office, or visit our Find a Specialist page to find a practitioner near you!

data.name: Heart Zones USA
data.about:
Heart Zones USA is the company that created the original and is now the world leader in heart-rate training branded and patented systems beginning in 1993. The company leads events, publishes content, and develops new mobile technologies as a consultant or hands-on like the Blink, the flashing zones heart rate monitor. In 2011, Sally Edwards' Heart Zones Training or HZT system was issued its first patent - US Pat No 809238. HZT and ZONING are the only patented cardio systems in the world.

Expanding with new mobile devices, we have added power meters, speed-and-distance monitors, smart fabrics, sensors, and VO2 metabolic carts to our technology application expertise. Heart Zones is world recognized as the experts in the development of programs, products, and specialty applications for weight management, emotional fitness training, swim-bike-run training, school PE and health, hospitals-based programs, and other applications of devices that work in the real world.

If you apply HZT, the branded and patented Heart Zones Training system you quickly discover that you have more energy and less stress, and you will get in touch with the most important muscle in your body â your heart - whether you are a fitness buff, an athlete, or some one who aspires to live a healthy and active life.

    * Additionally, receive Continuing Education Units from national organizations.

What You Get:

    * The 190-page Indoor Triathlon Coaching Manual
    * Learn how to administer, interpret, and explain the results of swim-bike-run fitness assessments.
    * A Certificate of Completion.

    * Entitlement to use the rank: Heart Zones ITC, Indoor Triathlon Coach seal to market and distinguish yourself.

data.name: KettleBell Concepts (KBC)
data.about:
In business since 2002, KettleBell Concepts (KBC) is the business to business leader in kettlebell education for highly credentialed, currently practicing fitness professionals globally. The depth, breath, and scope of the materials presented are geared solely toward fitness and other allied health professionals. With over 5,000 trained and counting, KettleBell Concepts is the only place fitness industry leaders, fitness professionals and other allied health professionals go to get education, products and business solutions for programming. All courses are CEC approved and on the product side their KBC-brand kettlebells are distributed exclusively by KBCâs distributorâSIL FITNESSâa company with a 20 year history in the fitness marketplace.

Science & Research

KBCâs material is extensively annotated and backed by the latest research. Courses are conducted in the language of science with the understanding that attendees are trained, properly credentialed, currently practicing fitness professional working with clients of all types.

We ignore dogma. We eschew âgurus.â KBC has always (and will continue) to seek the âwhyâs behind the howâs.â The goal is to create, encourage, and cultivate critical thinking skills that will apply not just to kettlebells, but to other modalities as well as you continue on in your fitness journey.

The kettlebell is just a tool. A great tool to be sureâand itâs something that can bring a lot to not only your clients, but to you as well as a business owner. But it isâstillâjust a tool. We encourage our students to be wary of swallowing too much of any one type of Coolaide.

Welcome to your first step with KBC.

For a list of industry "firsts" and to learn more, click here: http://tinyurl.com/7qrxybk

Training Information:
Balletone: Sole Synthesis is the perfect starting place for the Balletone programs. The Sole Synthesis Instructor training is designed to showcase the Balletone Blueprint for Success and highlight the fitness, dance/pilates and yoga pathways available.  Sole Synthesis is also a fabulous stand alone, fusion class that seamlessly blends creative movement sequences with mindful instruction for an incredible workout.

The Sole Synthesis Instructor Training will focus on how to seamlessly combine various disciplines (fitness, ballet, yoga) within one class using the fundamental teaching techniques and primary concepts of Balletone.  A basic overview of each of disciplineâs unique attributes and theory will be reviewed and discussed along with how they can relate and compliment one another.  Objectives will be introduced with a theoretical approach and reinforced through practical application.  Skills and drills will allow the attendees to develop an understanding of how the educational elements of Balletone can be utilized to enhance group or one-on-one instruction regardless of the population or discipline being used.  This workshop is designed for group exercise, Pilates and Yoga instructors, and possibly personal trainers. 

Program Description:
When barefoot training meets strength, cardio and flexibility in one workout, fitness takes on a whole new meaning.  Sole Synthesis is âsimplicity through triplicityâ â¦ no fancy moves here, the idea is to simply use a movement youâve done for ages and transform it seamlessly in three different ways with ONE outcome â a proactive workout rooted in functional training that will leave you strong, centered, and actively flexible from the ground up.

Training Information:
Balletone: Standing Flow is a fusion-style conditioning program, designed specifically for the non-dancer, blending training techniques drawn from dance, Pilates and fitness.  Balletone offers a fun, invigorating workout to develop core strength, muscular endurance, dynamic balance and flexibility without the use of equipment or props. Referred to as "...fitness for the millennium", Standing Flow keeps you moving, motivated and mentally focused with a body blasting workout that leaves no muscle untouched.

This Instructor Training will introduce the concepts and values of the Balletone program with a hands-on approach.  Objectives will be reinforced through practical application and participation.  Skills and drills will allow the attendees to develop an understanding of how the elements of Balletone can be utilized to enhance group or one-on-one instruction regardless of the population.  The workshop is designed for group exercise, Pilates and Yoga instructors, dance educators and possibly personal trainers.

Program Description:
BalletoneÂ®: Standing Flow is the âoriginalâ Balletone workout blending dance and fitness into a mind-body exercise class that is an explosion of graceful movement. Created by Jody Hoegstedt as a new class designed to strengthen, stretch and motivate, Standing Flow creates a challenging mix of muscle conditioning and stretching exercises designed to lengthen, strengthen and energize the entire body with movements derived from Ballet inspired movements. By blending principles from classical Ballet, Pilates, stretching and fitness, Standing Flow delivers a unique approach to creating, delivering and enjoying exercise.

data.name: canfitpro
data.about:
canfitpro is the largest provider of education in the Canadian fitness industry. Founded in 1993, canfitpro delivers accessible, quality education, certifications, conferences, trade shows, and membership services. canfitproâs over 65,000 members include some of the worldâs finest fitness professionals, health club operators, industry suppliers, and fitness consumers.

 

canfitpro provides the following member services:

â¢Educational conferences throughout the year 
â¢Certification courses, exams and resources 
â¢Bi-monthly magazine for our members 
â¢Shopping opportunities at our trade shows across the country 
â¢Job postings network for club owners, managers, and program directors 
â¢Discounted liability insurance program 
â¢Networking opportunities for fitness professionals and fitness consumers 
Facts about canfitpro:

â¢canfitpro is Canadaâs largest certification organization for fitness professionals. 
â¢canfitpro offers education for both fitness professionals and fitness consumers. 
â¢canfitpro hosts more than 10 fitness conferences across Canada annually. 
â¢The canfitpro International Fitness and Club Business Conference and Trade Show is the largest combined fitness conference and trade show in the world with over 9,000 delegates and visitors.

attrs.value: The role of a Fitness Instructor Specialist has evolved far beyond being a basic "aerobic instructor". As a group exercise expert, you will assist club members in a fun and motivating setting. A qualified Fitness Instructor Specialist can lead groups in various formats of cardiovascular conditioning, muscle strength and endurance training, stretching and relaxation, or a calming cool-down. A canfitpro certified FIS is knowledgeable about different types of music, understands how to use music in a group setting, keeps current on the latest fitness trends and is able to give generalized advice about healthy living and proper nutrition.

Maintaining wellness requires the consistent use of practical strategies with an overall focus on the body, mind and spirit. This course will provide excellent tools for fitness professionals to help them counsel others about how to build a healthy body. This program is also very beneficial to all Canadians who want to learn practical ways to become more active, eat better and make a personal lifestyle change.

data.name: FallProof Balance and Mobility Specialist Instructor Certification (FallProof)
data.about:
Get the specialized knowledge and skills needed to lead effective balance and mobility programs.  The FallProofâ¢ Balance and Mobility Specialist Instructor Certificate Program is designed to provide physical activity instructors and health care professionals with the knowledge and practical skills necessary to implement an evidence-based balance and mobility training program for older adults at moderate-to-high risk for falls in community and residential care settings.

First of its Kind Certification
The FallProofâ¢ Balance and Mobility Specialist Instructor Certificate Program is the first and only program of its kind to be offered in the U.S.  The program has been extensively field-tested and shown to reduce the risk factors associated with falls among older adults.

data.name: British Columbia Recreation and Parks Association (BCRPA)
data.about:
The BCRPA is a provincial, not-for-profit professional association that has provided educational opportunities, information and advocacy to the parks, recreation, physical activity, and culture sector for over 50 years.

Through its Fitness Registration Program, the BCRPA acts as a regulatory body by collaboratively developing, recognizing and promoting provincial and national standards for the training and registration of fitness leaders in BC. With over 5,200 registered fitness leaders, the BCRPA is the largest fitness registry in Canada and has gained recognition as THE standard against which the qualifications of a fitness leader may be measured.

Areas of registration include: Group Fitness, Aquatic Fitness, Pilates Fitness, Yoga Fitness, Weight Training, Personal Training and Osteofit. Registration fees automatically include $2million of liability insurance valid for teaching anywhere in Canada (Personal Trainers must purchase their own policy).

As a member of the National Fitness Leadership Alliance (NFLA),registration with the BCRPA is transferable to other provinces across Canada.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: The HFA Nutrition Coach Certification is a must have certification for all fitness professionals.  It's a distance education program designed by a Holistic Nutritionist, a Dietician, and a Personal Trainer with years of experience working with fitness professionals and their clients in private practice.  The program includes books, videos, downloadable audio files, online forums to connect with other students and ongoing support from our nutrition team.  There are three sections to the program: 1) Foundations of Holistic Nutrition,  2) Nutrition Sciences & Applications, 3) Sports & Fitness Nutrition, 4) Meal Planning and Coaching Skills.   Graduates have unlimited access to hundreds of meal plans in a wide range of categories such as detox, weight loss, lactose intolerant, weight gain, blood sugar balance, vegetarian and many more.  Calorie ranges are from 1200-2600.   This is an invaluable tool to fitness professionals.   Graduates also receive forms, questionnaires and handouts to use immediately in practice.

data.name: Gray Institute (GI)
data.about:
The Gray Institute is internationally acclaimed for its innovation, development, mastery, and delivery of Applied Functional Science. We are recruited to consult, analyze, assess, rehabilitate, restore, train, and condition individuals of all levels and abilities, including professional sports.

We are the foremost leader of functional prevention, rehabilitation, and performance enhancement in our industry. Our state-of-the-art production studio and video suite enables us to deliver the most up-to-date functional information to our global customers and partners.

Our internationally-renowned staff of presenters has more than three decades of experience in presenting our Chain Reaction Transformation and Live Function seminars to teach professionals from all areas of the medical and training industries.

The GIFT Program (10-month mentorship) provides a unique, comprehensive, and in-depth professional education experience through a blend of distance learning and live seminars where all aspects of Applied Functional Science are explored, explained, and applied.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
3DMAPS (3D Movement Analysis & Performance System) is the most innovative way to effectively analyze and enhance the entire body in an efficient, revealing, and evidence-based manner. This certification equips you, the movement professional, with the content, competence, and confidence to meet the needs, wants, and goals of all of your patients and clients. Unlike any other movement screen, 3DMAPS is a movement analysis and performance system that applies to the three-dimensionality and abilities of all individuals and all of human function. 3DMAPS boils down all of human movement (the three-dimensional interaction of joints, muscles, and proprioceptors) into 6 Vital Transformational Zones, adapts these movements within Mobility Analysis Movements (assessing range of motion) and Stability Analysis Movements (assessing control of motion), and empowers you to then prioritize the best and most logical progressions in serving your patients and clients better. 

3D â¦ The human body moves three-dimensionally. All proprioceptors respond, all muscles react, and all joints move three-dimensionally. It only makes sense to analyze and progress the body three-dimensionally. 3DMAPS facilitates functional assessment and much, much more!

Movement â¦ 3DMAPS leverages movements â lunges, reaches, squats â that are paramount to common, everyday movements and activities. These movements are authentic to the individual and relevant to what the individual does. While other screens, scans, analyses, claim to be functional, 3DMAPS actually is.

Analysis â¦ 3DMAPS analyzes the entire bodyâs mobility (flexibility, range of motion) and stability (strength, control of motion) and then identifies a Relative Success Code specific to individual â based on symmetries, asymmetries, and disabling pain within the movements.

Performance â¦ 3DMAPS enhances the function of the individual and progresses systematically and scientifically for optimal function and improvement.

System â¦ Performance Movements parallel Analysis Movements, thus creating a seamless and intuitive process for both the practitioner and the patient / client.

data.name: National College of Exercise Professionals (NCEP)
data.about:
The National College of Exercise Professionals (NCEP) has been a leader in Fitness Industry Education and Exercise Professionals for over two decades. NCEP was born out of the original Sports Club Company in Los Angeles. Michael DeMora, the Founder and President of NCEP was a Fitness Manager for the Sports Club Company, and eventually the Director of Education for the Spectrum Clubs Company, which branched out from the Sports Club Company. Mike created NCEP from his wealth of knowledge in the Fitness Industry and from his elite education with two masters degrees.

What Makes Us Different: 
There are many significant difference between the National College of Exercise Professionals and other organizations. We are a Fitness Industry Education group dedicated to the most cutting edge exercise science often known as Functional Training. The best club companies in the Fitness Industry are embracing the Functional Training approach and we truly believe that our method takes it to an even higher level. Our proprietary approach is called Athletic Performance Enhancement, and we offer a variety of certifications and continuing education workshops. NCEP is accredited by the National Exercise Therapy Association National Board of Certification, and we work primarily with high end health club companies. We are a preferred certification and education provider for the Sports Club Company (owners and operators of the Sports Club/LA clubs across the country), the Oregon Athletic Clubs (an elite club chain in the Portland area), and the Honolulu Club (the finest club in the state of Hawaii). We've also worked closely with many other top national club companies including the Spectrum Clubs, Lifetime Fitness, Golds Gym and Fitness 19.

Also, while many other certification companies are going increasingly online, we strongly believe in teaching our classes live and in person, because many people learn best with visual interaction and because fitness is a personal interaction. We maintain a low student to faculty ratio often under 15 students per class to offer a more conducive atmosphere to learn. What really makes us special is our staff dedicated to brining the students the most recent up to date infomation in an easily digestable manner.
Another aspect about our curriculum that separates us from the other certifications in the industry is that we also teach professional skills including sales, five star service, and professional etiquette. Due to our extensive work with the Sports Club Company, we are uniquely qualified as an education provider of these critical components for a successful personal training program.
We also believe in getting out into the communities and teaching our classes at the club level. Many certification companies are increasingly going on line, and while this is very convenient, it is our philosophy that the process of learning fitness is enhanced by personal interaction.
While we are a smaller company than some of the certification mills in our industry, we are growing in our reputation and recognition. As we like to say "We're small but we're mighty" or as Shakespeare wrote, "Though she be but little, she is fierce." We work harder and smarter than our competition and we also offer a lower price and a much better value.

Course Options: 
We offer a Standard Personal Training Certification as well as numerous specialty certifications, including Advanced Program Design, Functional Assessments, Functional Anatomy, Holistic Health Practitioner, Exercise Therapist, and our MMA Trainer certification. This program combines our Personal Training certification with MMA curriculum and graduates are certified as a Personal Trainer, a Strength and Conditioning Coach for MMA, and as an MMA Trainer (or Coach) for the sport. This program has been created in conjunction with Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts and it has been endorsed by the State of Hawaii MMA Commissioner and the United States Military.

certifications.title: NCEP-Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer Certification Program

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
The National College of Exercise Professionals and Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer Certification Program

Get the national MMA trainer certification from the leader in exercise professionals to start your career in this exciting and growing industry or take it to another level!

Great for personal trainers who want to learn how to train MMA athletes, martial arts instructors who want to add MMA conditioning to their school curriculum or any one who wants to learn how to train in this dynamic sport.

Topics include: *MMA Strength and Conditioning, *MMA training techniques, *fight strategies, *functional training, *athletic skills training, *core and balance training, *performance enhancement training and *professional skills to achieve success as an MMA trainer.


Based on the fitness science curriculum of the leader in exercise professionals - NCEP! And the MMA training methods of some of the best instructors in the world, including Leo Fong (Bruce Lee's close friend and training partner), Gene Lebell (the Godfather of Grappling), the Machado Brothers (Pioneers of Brazilian Jujitsu), and Greg Jackson (top MMA instructor).

The NCEP - Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer program has been endorsed by the Commissioner of MMA for the State of Hawaii and by the United States Military Veterans Administration as an educational program to develop MMA Trainers and future leaders in the sport and the MMA Industry.

Graduates of the NCEP - Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer Certification program will be certified as a National College of Exercise Professionals Personal Trainer, a Strength and Conditioning Coach for MMA and a Rainbow Warrior MMA Trainer/Coach for the sport of Mixed Martial Arts. The program includes almost 50 hours of training and education curriculum for the cost of $999.

To register or for more information call: (310) 430-3664

Company Overview
In 1995, SchwinnÂ® introduced the first bike ever designed specifically for indoor group cycling, and we've been at the forefront of the phenomenon ever since. We combine next-generation cycling technology with a global team of Master Instructors to provide the most integrated, comprehensive solution available for the cycling studio.

We believe that riding a bike indoors should feel as much like riding an outdoor bike as possible. We love the way bikes feel, we love the way they sound, and we love the great workout they can provide. attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Myofascial Compression Techniques (MCT) are TriggerPoint's revolutionary form of self myofascial release that systematically restores tissue elasticity, and enhances fluidity and function, resulting in pain reduction, reduced risk of injury, and performance enhancement. MCT can be utilized with a wide array of clients- from the weekend warrior to the advanced athlete.

MCT Programming can range from general areas of the body, to specific programming including the Ultimate 6+ areas. This can be used in conjunction with a movement assessment, or based off of specific training protocols.

This course will take you through the Ultimate 6. The Ultimate 6 are the six muscles (Soleus, Quadriceps, Psoas, Piriformis, Pectorals, Thoracic Spine) that influence biomechanics the greatest. By manipulating these six keys muscles, your body can achieve structural integrity, thus creating a platform for optimal performance and injury prevention. This course also includes what is referred to as the plus areas, the plus categories (Calf, Soleus/Calf, Anterior Tibialis, Perononeus, Inner Quad (VMO), Latissimus Dorsi) also play a major role in movement and will add to the overall effectiveness of treating the body systematically.

Combining these two elements allows you to maximize time and effectiveness as you boost client and athlete performance with the health benefits of massage and total body exercise. In this training, you will learn the advantages of SMRT-COREÂ® programming, proper execution of movements on the GRIDâ¢ foam roller, how to implement SMRT-COREÂ® programming into different markets, and effective coaching and cueing techniques.

data.name: Polestar
data.about: Polestar is a worldwide provider of rehabilitation-based Pilates education, producing high-caliber Pilates teachers and successful Pilates studio models. Polestar's teacher training programs are offered on an ongoing basis in cities across the USA and through licensee arrangements in over 28 countries. Polestar-trained Pilates teachers can be found at medical facilities, performing arts conservatories and fitness centers throughout the world. Polestar owns and operates Polestar Physical Therapy and Pilates Center in Miami, FL, USA, which serves as a training site and as a model of successful integration of Pilates for rehabilitation.

data.name: Yoga Tune UpÂ® (YTU)
data.about:
Yoga Tune UpÂ®, developed and created by internationally renowned Yoga instructor, Jill Miller, is a 'whole body' regenerative fitness system integrating elements of Yoga, calisthenics and body therapy. The poses, routines and structure of this format are deeply rooted in discovering the biomechanics and physiology of each individual, as an individual, helping to create lasting structural change. Yoga Tune UpÂ® approaches the body as a living archaeological dig, probing layers of muscle, tendons, connective tissues and joints, and excavating unhealthy tension patterns until your students are moved back into complete physiological balance.
The accessible nature and style of Yoga Tune UpÂ® fills classes and workshops with a broad spectrum of both men and women ranging from athletes, professionals, yogis, and doctors, to boomers becoming active for the first time.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: For yoga teachers, advanced yoga practitioners, Pilates and fitness teachers, massage therapists, dancers, and martial artists. This 20 hour immersion is designed to enhance your connection to the abdominal core and is filled with practical tools for effectively integrating core work into your practice and teaching. Through embodied anatomy exercises, you will systematically travel within your core to explore the key structures that mobilize and stabilize the spine. Using Jill's original Yoga Tune UpÂ® techniques, you will strengthen and stretch every last muscle fiber. You will be introduced to several core-related pranayama techniques to directly experience your diaphragm and experience daily self-massage with Yoga Tune UpÂ® therapy balls. Learn how to apply core work to your daily yoga practice, as well as ways of integrating and sequencing the exercises in a class setting. Unique empowerment exercises will address the emotional blocks that often obscure core work, so that you may uncover and resolve your third chakra issues, and ultimately inspire others.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: This 20 hour training is open to students and teachers who wish to deepen their knowledge and understanding of Yoga Tune UpÂ® processes and fitness therapy practices. The specific anatomy of the hips, legs, knees ankles and feet are explored in depth. Trainees are guided through a variety of hands-on adjustments, new assessment strategies, injury scenarios, deeper meditation instruction, and improving their teaching performance of these specific body regions. The Trainees are presented with "template" workshops aimed to inspire their own creative workshops and classes. No prior experience with Yoga Tune UpÂ® is required, although it is helpful. The Immersion can be taken at any point in a teachers journey towards certification. Required for YTU Integrated Certificate and for Yoga Tune UpÂ® Therapist consideration.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Learn anatomy from the inside-out. This comprehensive anatomy module (15 - 20 hrs.) expertly guides you into your living tissues in a concrete and inspiring way. It provides you with a directly personal experience of the interplay of the many complex systems of the body and helps you to make them relevant and tangible for your students. Learn how the multiple layers of the body relate and function as a whole while simultaneously exploring specific anatomical structures, physiological processes and typical movement patterns and pathologies.

The unique YTU approach not only helps you to embody anatomy, but our educational methodology drastically improves any students' retention of the clinical language of anatomy in a completely accessible and fun way.Dynamic movement, combined with video, 3-D models, palpation, and self-massage tools and techniques,will invite you to traverse the muscles, joints, bones and fascia and their interrelatedness to breath, circulation, immunity, injury and newfound functional movement patterns. The curriculum is suitable for yogis of all levels, but also ideal for any movement professional who desires to sharpen their ability to perceive within themselves as well as correctly locate in others, the vital structural landmarks and meaningful continuities of the body within any yoga or fitness practice. Make anatomy relevant to you, and your students will follow!

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: The Yoga Tune UpÂ® Level 1 70 hour Certification Program strikes a balance between the worlds of Yoga and fitness, attracting trainees of all ages and body types. It breaks down the nuts and bolts of human movement by using a yogic lens of awareness, conscious relaxation, and proper breathing techniques. The Level 1 environment fosters trainees into a newly intimate understanding of their own architecture. Yoga Tune UpÂ® trainees dive deeply into integrated anatomy and body mechanics while discovering a fresh approach to Asana. You will go beyond formulaic instruction and truly learn how to think and teach creatively within your classroom. Trainees are presented with "template" Yoga Tune UpÂ® classes to help jumpstart their teaching. Successful completion and certification of the Level 1 training is mandatory prior to teaching any Yoga Tune UpÂ® classes. Level 1 is required for YTU Integrated Certificate and for Yoga Tune UpÂ® Therapist consideration.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: This 20 hour training is open to students and teachers who wish to deepen their knowledge and understanding of Yoga Tune UpÂ® processes and fitness therapy practices.The Shoulders Immersion focuses specifically on the intricate anatomy and physiology of the shoulders, arms, wrists, hands, head and neck, and breaks down these areas in fine detail. Coursework involves multiple embodied explorations of the upper body and the kinetic relationships of the shoulders to the core, the mind, and structural integrity. Trainees are guided through a variety of hands-on adjustments, self-care strategies with the YTU Balls, injury scenarios, pranayama (breath-based exercises), meditation,  and improving their teaching performance of these specific body regions. Trainees are presented with "template" workshops aimed to inspire their own creative workshops and classes. No prior experience with Yoga Tune UpÂ® is required, although it is helpful. The Immersion can be taken at any point in a teachers journey towards certification.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
This 4-6 hour certificate course empowers professionals from any body-based discipline to help clients of any level of fitness to adopt a simple and effective self-care regimen. The Yoga Tune UpÂ® Therapy Balls can be used as an adjunct offering within personal training sessions, stretch, pilates, dance classes, wellness coaching, yoga, massage therapy, kids or special populations. The balls put the power of self-massage into your clientsâ own hands. You will learn 6 proven head-to-toe series, approved by body therapy professionals to affect profound change in the rotator cuff, upper back, neck, jaw, hips, lower back, IT Band, calves and feet (plus you will take home recordings of all of the sequences.) You will learn to identify bony landmarks, muscular attachments, fascia geography, and specialized ball rolling techniques that penetrate into common high tension areas. Clients at every level of fitness OR disability are ushered into the awareness of their own anatomy, helping you build their confidence and ability to live better in their body....PAIN FREE! 
These on-the-go balls can be used in a variety of settings; offices, homes, gyms, yoga/pilates studios and are a profitable revenue stream for teachers, gyms and studios.YTU Therapy Ball Sequences increase your teaching tool-kit and are a great way to introduce embodied anatomy concepts to your student base. Plus you'll have fun while educating others! Learning these sequences benefit your own self-preservation and will help you to maintain a healthy body, preventing injuries and saving you time and money on massage therapists and other costly treatments. (ACE CECs .4)

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: Upon completion of 200 hours of combined Level 1 and Immersion trainings (all courses listed above) certified YTU teachers in good-standing may submit a 40 hour research project that includes a proven Yoga Tune UpÂ® Therapy sequence for either an individual or a control group with specific conditions directed towards improving quality of life.

data.name: PROPTA - Professional Personal Trainers Association (PROPTA)
data.about: Founded in 1980, the Personal Trainers Association (PROPTA) is a worldwide organization promoting health and nutrition in over 183 countries in 7 languages. PROPTA offers many certifications course providing the only hands on practical proper biomechanics to every student. PROPTA is the only organization officially endorsed by the largest fitness and bodybuilding federation in the world the International Federation of Fitness and Bodybuilding "IFBB" "IFBB PRO League". Accredited and Approved in the US and in many Universities abroad. PROPTA is also GI Bill approved.

Course Summary:
The Dynamax Coach Clinic is designed to instruct strength and conditioning coaches and sport performance professionals on how to integrate and apply Dynamax movement-based medicine ball training into their sport specific programming.

Course Detail: 
This clinic will teach Dynamax Medicine Ball movement based training for athletes which focuses on force summation and movement integration.  Coaches will discover how Dynamax Medicine Ball training addresses and integrates the 10 Physical Skills maximizing athletic potential.  Attendees will also learn the essentials of program design, cueing, coaching techniques, and how to assess sport specific movement patterns to apply the appropriate medicine ball exercises.   

Course Objectives:
1.	Distinguish the difference between Dynamax movement-based medicine ball training and traditional medicine ball training.
2.	Learn over 12 foundational exercises that combine rotation, locomotion, and floor-based work to develop controlled speed and power. 
3.	Comprehend how to select, program, and coach Dynamax medicine ball exercises for an athlete and their sport specific needs.

data.name: VIVOBAREFOOT Training Clinic (VIVOBAREFOOT)
data.about: Introduced in 2011, the VIVOBAREFOOT Training Clinic is designed and directed by leading biomechanics expert, Lee Saxby, to be the ultimate resource in barefoot movement education. Following the success of Saxbyâs eBook â Proprioception: Making Sense of Barefoot Running â The VIVOBAREFOOT Coaching Program launched to certify coaches across the world; specialized to diagnose and correct running form by understanding the science and application of the mental and physical components of running. Once certified, coaches are added to a growing database online where they can be contacted for personal or group training sessions. More information on the VIVOBAREFOOT Training Clinic and registration for the VIVOBAREFOOT Coaching Program can be found at trainingclinic.vivobarefoot.com.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Introduction:
This comprehensive program, covering both the practical and theoretical components of running, is taught by internationally renowned barefoot running expert, Lee Saxby. Participants will have the opportunity to gain certification in coaching the skill of barefoot running and become part of growing international network of VIVOBAREFOOT Certified Coaches.
Teaching Methods:
â¢ Hands on experience by analyzing and correcting participantsâ
personal running technique using the latest video analysis
and plantar pressure software
â¢ Comprehensive overview of the biomechanics and psychophysiology
of running
â¢ A coaching template used in conjunction with available diagnostic
equipment to analyze and correct running form using coaching
cues and drills

Program Design:
The VIVOBAREFOOT Coaching Program: Barefoot Technique Certification course is designed to be a five day intensive course either as consecutive days or three weekends.

Module 1 (Day 1): Running Clinic
Analyze and correct current running form

Module 2 (Day 2 & 3): Science Clinic
Dive deep into the science of the mental and physical components of running

Module 3 (Day 4 & 5): Coaching Clinic

Visualizing the coaching template and the drills available to correct technique
To conclude the program and earn the coaching certificate, participants are
required to pass a written exam and submit three case studies where theyâve
improved different subjectsâ running form through their coaching methods.
All participants are held to the highest standards and are not awarded the official certificate until theyâve received an 80% or higher on this rigorous exam.

Program Benefits:
VIVOBAREFOOT Certified Coaches are free to generate income while marketing themselves with the VIVOBAREFOOT brand.

The VIVOBAREFOOT Training Clinic website will direct local customers interested in 1:1 and group sessions to coaches in their area.

VIVOBAREFOOT Certified Coaches are extremely well placed to help the growing number of runners of all abilities who want to transition to a natural, injury free running style.

All VIVOBAREFOOT Certified Coaches receive a Coaching Program Manual
containing presentations from the course, a hard copy of Proprioception:
Making Sense of Barefoot Running, DVDs with barefoot training exercises, relevant research and additional readings.

Certificates are signed by Daniel Lieberman, Harvard Professor of Evolutionary Biology and author of leading modern day barefoot research.

data.name: Kathy Corey Pilates
data.about:
Kathy Corey is a Master Teacher who began her career with the Pilates Technique in 1979.   She has been the leading expert in the Pilates community for over 30 years.  She is the Director of Kathy Corey Pilates. The Kathy Corey Pilates Certification Program is taught at locations across the United States and her continuing education programs are taught in twenty-four countries. In 2004, she designed the innovative CORE Bandâ¢, which is used in studios around the world.  The Core Bandâ¢ Mat Class is recognized as an enhancement to the traditional mat exercises. 

Since 2007, Corey has been a member of the IDEA Pilates Task Force.  She is on the Contributing Editor Board for IDEA Pilates Today and invited to be profiled as an IDEA Expert. 

She is an Advisory Board Member for Pilates Style Magazine and a member of the Board of Advisors for the American Fitness Professional Association (AFPA).

Corey was appointed to the faculty of the University of AlcalÃ¡, Spain, the first University to incorporate Pilates into a Master of Science degree program.

PilatesAnytime.com has invited Kathy Corey to be a âDistinguished Instructorâ.  Pilates Anytime is a global Pilates Studio, created for people all over the world to explore Pilates with highly skilled, well-trained instructors.  

Corey is PMA Pilates Gold Certified and she has been selected by IDEA as one of ten people in the world âWho Inspire the World to Fitness,â the fitness industryâs highest form of recognition.

data.name: Alan Herdman Pilates
data.about:
Alan Herdman studied at the London School of Contemporary Dance and was working as a teacher and dancer when, in the late 1960s, he was invited to New York to learn about the Joseph Pilates Method. There he worked intensively with Carola Trier and Bob Fitzgerald, two instructors who had been trained by Pilates himself. Although well-regarded amongst New York's dance fraternity, Pilates was unknown in the UK at that time and Alan returned in 1970 to set up Britain's first-ever Pilates studio. Among his first clients were actors, dancers and singers, but word soon spread as doctors and physiotherapists began recommending Pilates to patients struggling with chronic injuries.

Alan now lectures on Pilates around the world, and he has written several successful books, including The Pilates Directory (2004), The Gaia Busy Person's Guide to Pilates (2003) and Pilates: Creating the Body You Want (1999). He runs a training course for Pilates instructors and, as well as running his own studios, he and his assistants teach in dance schools and designated Pilates studios internationally.

data.name: Moms In Motion (MIM)
data.about:
Moms In Motion is an international fitness community for moms. We believe moms are at their best when they take care of themselves first. Our leaders provide sport specific teams ranging from running, triathlon, cycling, core conditioning, walking, hiking etc...lasting between 8-12 weeks and typically ending with a culminating event. Most leaders provide 3-4 teams a year to build their MIM community. 

Our leaders include moms, personal trainers, coaches, teachers, physical therapists, group fitness, yoga & pilates instructors, and just about anyone who is interested in and passionate about motherhood and fitness.

Our leaders value supporting moms and therefore their families, friends and colleagues to live a healthy, fit life. This rippling effect combined with our unique concept of fun, fitness and philanthropy sets us a part from other "training" teams. There's nothing like Moms In Motion and our leaders appreciate providing something unique and meaningful within their community. When you lead a Moms In Motion Team, you will experience a tremendous sense of personal satisfaction, accomplishment and gratitude.

data.name: Ageless Grace
data.about: Ageless GraceÂ® is a fitness and wellness program created by Denise Medved. The program consists of 21 simple exercise Tools designed for all ages and abilities. These exercises, based on everyday movements that are natural and organic, focus on the healthy longevity of the body and mind. The 21 Tools have creative, imaginative names, so they are easy to remember. They are simple to do at home. The movements are designed to be performed seated in a chair, yet they can be done on a bed, standing near or behind a chair, down on the floor, or standing. Almost anyone can do them, regardless of most physical conditions.

data.name: Canadian Fitness Education Services (CFES)
data.about:
CFES Fitness Leadership Program modules are designed to take students through the steps for fitness instructor and Personal Trainer certification.

As well as providing  certification, CFES courses are also recognized by a variety of specialized fitness leadership agencies, including: the Canadian Aquatics Leaders Alliance (CALA); the Canadian Personal Trainers Network (CPTN), Canfitpro (GFI + PT = PT/FIS equivalency) and National Fitness Leadership Alliance (NFLA). The CFES Fitness Knowledge Course and CFES Weight Training Instructor Courses are approved by the Massage Therapist Associations of Alberta and Saskatchewan for credits for Continuing Education/Professional Development. Our programs are also integrated within college health and fitness diploma programs in Canada. 

CFES resources are also recognized by the BC Ministry of Education and Alberta Education and utilized in individual Ontario Board Authorized high school physical education credit courses grades 9 to 12 students. The CFES Fitness Knowledge Course is listed in both the BC Min. of  Ed's Integrated Resource Package and highlighted in their Grade Collection for meeting the most learning outcomes for PE 10/12 students and on Education Alberta's Learning Centre.

attrs.value:
The CFES Aquafit Instructor Course (AFI) covers the unique properties of water, music rhythm, equipment options and how to provide an effective and progressive water exercise program for participants of all ages.

The AFI course is 24+ hours of classroom theory and in-the-water practical training with an end of course open book completion exam; followed by an 8-20 hour practicum; a one-hour closed book proctored certification exam; and a 90 minute instructor skills assessment. Passing grade is 80%. Instructors are expected to maintain CPR + First Aid tickets and obtain liability insurance (if necessary).

Prerequisite: CFES Fitness Knowledge Course or equivalent.

attrs.label: Prerequisite
attrs.value: CFES Fitness Knowledge Course or equivalent.

Description
attrs.value:
The CFES Group Fitness Instructor (GFI) is a practical based program  designed to teach foundation instructor skills to lead a basic group fitness class.  Students will learn how to develop and modify a lesson plan, work with music and choreograph routines, use equipment effectively and safely, cuing and communication skills and professional ethics.

The CFES GFI course is taken following the pre-requisite CFES Fitness Knowledge Course (or equivalent).

The GFI course is 24+ hours of classroom theory and on-the-floor practical training with an end of course open book completion exam; followed by an 8-20 hour practicum; a one-hour closed book proctored certification exam; and a 90 minute instructor skills assessment. Passing grade is 80%. Instructors are expected to maintain CPR + First Aid tickets and obtain liability insurance (if necessary).

Description
attrs.value:
The information presented in the CFES Personal Trainer (PT) course is comprehensive and academically credible. Students will gain more advanced theory in a classroom setting and put that into practice. The program teaches how to assist clients make positive lifestyle changes by assessing health related fitness levels and providing sound, evidence-based advise on both physical activities and healthy eating habits. Pre-requisite CFES Weight Training Instructor Course, or equivalent.

The PT course is 40+ hours of classroom and practical teaching, and also includes a course completion open book exam; followed by a 20-hour practicum, closed book proctored certification exam and skills assessment. Passing grade is 80%. PTs are expected to maintain CPR + First Aid tickets and obtain liability insurance.

The CFES Weight Training Instructor (WTI) Course is a practical course designed to teach foundation leadership skills to develop and supervise basic weight training programs. Learn about the weight training industry, fitness testing, scientific training principles and program design, teaching and safety cuing techniques, counselling and communication skills, nutrition and supplements and professional ethics. 

The CFES WTI course is 24+ hours of classroom theory and on-the-floor practical training with an end of course open book completion exam; followed by an 8-20 hour practicum; a one-hour closed book proctored certification exam; and a 90 minute instructor skills assessment. Passing grade is 80%. Instructors are expected to maintain CPR + First Aid tickets and obtain liability insurance (if necessary).

data.name: National Society of Physical Activity Practitioners in Public Health (NSPAPPH)
data.about: The National Society of Physical Activity Practitioners in Public Health (NSPAPPH) is a professional organization dedicated to growing the capacity of physical activity practitioners in public health. Those who work in this emerging field come from various academic backgrounds and professions, including health promotion and education, public health, exercise science and exercise physiology, and physical education. NSPAPPH intends to elevate physical activity in public health practice at national, state, and local levels through professional development.

data.name: Power Plate
data.about:
About Power Plate, the most storied brand in the whole body vibration category

Whole body vibration was first used by the cosmonauts to combat muscle and bone loss caused by extended stays in zero gravity. Today, Power Plate has continued developing the technology to create products and training programs that deliver legendary performance for professional sports teams, medical facilities, health clubs, studios and individuals around the globe.

As the worldâs leader in whole body vibration technology, people of all ages and physical abilities trust Power Plate to bring their bodies into harmonyâthe place where optimal physical performance, health and wellness are all in balance and working together. In fact, Power Plate has been linked to a wide range of health and wellness benefits, from strength, balance, flexibility and weight loss to improved circulation, pain reduction, detoxification, stress alleviation, and even reduction in the appearance of cellulite.

Along with delivering great performance for individuals and fitness facilities, doctors in nearly 100 countries use Power Plate to help their patients live life to the fullest. 
As the worldâs leader in whole body vibration technology, people of all ages and physical abilities trust Power Plate to bring their bodies into harmonyâthe place where optimal physical performance, health and wellness are all in balance and working together. In fact, Power Plate has been linked to a wide range of health and wellness benefits, from strength, balance, flexibility, and promoting weight loss by increasing metabolic demand, to improved circulation, pain reduction, and stress alleviation.

Power Plate is the only brand of whole body vibration systems for which the entire company, including itâs factory, are certified by the UKâs Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency.  As such, Power Plate branded products are produced in adherence to the absolute highest quality standards in its category.

Our goal is educate the world and provide the most current, relevant, and up to date information regarding whole body vibration (WBV). This includes education on the mechanisms by which WBV enhances the neuromusculoskeletal system; the method of nerve to muscle adaptation called Reflexive Stabilization; and the opportunity to experience the fundamentals of functional movement and integration. Our education is inspired by Applied Functional Science (AFS)Â® powered by Gray InstituteÂ®.

data.name: Cancer Exercise Training Institute
data.about:
The Cancer Exercise Training Institute (CETI) was established in 1996 by nationally recognized author and Cancer Exercise Specialist Andrea Leonard in response to a growing need to provide scientifically-based, current information on exercise therapy as a critical component of cancer recovery.

CETI provides health and fitness professionals with comprehensive coursework on twenty-five types of cancer, their surgeries and treatments, breast reconstruction, upper and lower body lymphedema prevention, identification, and management, cancer pain and fatigue, and comprehensive fitness evaluations including postural assessment and goniometry. In addition, CETI teaches targeted marketing strategies, enabling our graduates to create strategic partnerships with the medical professionals in their community, and positioning them as the "next step" in the health care continuum.

data.name: LaBlast
data.about:
LaBlast is an innovative partner-free dance fitness program created by world renowned dancer, coach, choreographer, Dancing with the Stars fan favorite and fitness expert, Louis Van Amstel.


LaBlast is a dance based fitness workout that incorporates elements from several types of dance, including:


- Cha Cha Cha
- Disco
- Jive
- Lindy Hop
- Merengue
- Paso Doble
- Quick Step
- Salsa
- Samba


The program uniquely fuses fitness routines and movements into dance training. Music is a key component to the classes, using a wide variety of genres ranging from pop, rock, hip hop, country and disco to create a fun, energetic club-like atmosphere. The result is a high-energy experience that makes you want to dance!

LaBlast is designed for all levels â from the absolute beginner to the experienced dancer. It is a multi-level program at which students can progress at their own rate. Students begin with an introduction to the program providing the foundation and base techniques used in LaBlast. As the program progresses, the intensity of the workout increases, dances and choreography are expanded, and technique and details are refined.

Whether you want to tone your body, maintain a healthy lifestyle, learn to dance, or just have a great time, LaBlast offers something for everyone!

data.name: World Fitness Association (WFA)
data.about:
World Fitness Association (WFA) is a National Fitness Certification and Training Center located in east Fort Lauderdale, FL. Our unique hands-on, practical training approach prepares aspiring trainers for modern, real world scenarios. WFA is the preferred alternative to online and study-at-home certification programs. World Fitness Association is dedicated to the practical education and professional excellence in the health and fitness industry. 

World Fitness Association has been training and certifying fitness professionals for over 35 years in the South Florida region as well as across the country. World Fitness Association produces some of the most confident, cutting-edge, dynamic and creative personal trainers in the industry. This is a direct result of the experienced high character students that we enroll and the real world, practical training that we provide. Training courses include the utilization of a variety of portable equipment such as free weights, resistance bands, medicine balls, stability balls, jump ropes, bosu balls, agility ladders, battle ropes, foam rollers, thera bands, sliders, kettlebells, resistance tubing, TRX suspension training and more. Our high value trainers learn the importance of building interest and excitement within a fitness facility and are educated on how to build rapport with members in a strategic, non-threatening manner. All certification and training courses are led by licensed educators with advanced degrees and years of successful experience making our student's success our mission.

World Fitness Association is the only fitness certification and training center that gets its trainers JOB READY. WFA continues to staff thousands of major gyms and health clubs across the country. World Fitness Association graduates also work in major corporations, hospitals, resorts, cruise ships, luxurious hotels, spas, private training studios and fitness centers across the country as well as around the world. Independent personal trainers provide mobile personal training alternatives by traveling to clientsâ homes, condos, office buildings, public parks, and beaches.

Description
attrs.value: PaddleFit Level 1 and Level 2 has evolved into PaddleFit Core. The definition of core: an essential and foundational part; a basic, essential enduring part. That definition is what PaddleFit Core represents: the essential and foundational elements of the PaddleFit coaching system. Our new certification model will reflect our commitment to being the best and providing an outstanding educational experience for our incoming coaches. By combining Level 1 and 2 into a comprehensive 2 day course will we be taking the necessary steps in raising the PaddleFit standard and creating an atmosphere and educational model to produce the best coaches. We are elevating the PaddleFit standards so this is not going to only be a name change. While most of the main components from Level 1 and 2 will be similar, PaddleFit Core will be a new, comprehensive 2 day experience. PaddleFit Core summary: â¢ 2 day course â¢ Day 1 will be an interactive teaching format with 20 to 30 videos, discussions and presentations â¢ Day 2 will be on the water and involve both skill assessments and practical teaching sessions â¢ Course will conclude with a comprehensive written exam as well as practical skill assessment â¢ Full technique and physical assessment will be performed â¢ Coaches will be introduced to the PaddleFit Technique Screenâ¢ which is a technique assessment tool

attrs.label: One Hour of Continuing Education Equals
Category
attrs.value: Aqua, Group Fitness, Life & Wellness Coaching, Personal Trainer, Special Populations, Sports Conditioning

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: PaddleFit Level 3 has evolved into PaddleFit Pro. The definition of pro: an expert that exemplifies great skill at his/her work and serves as a teacher, competitor or consultant. That definition establishes what type of individual that we are aiming to facilitate the development of through PaddleFit Pro. PaddleFit Pro is a comprehensive two day course that is going to challenge you both physically and mentally. Our goal is to have you understand and exhibit the attributes of a professional PaddleFit coach such as advanced technique, progressive training knowledge and advanced water skills. Taking what you learned in PaddleFit Core we are going to expand upon these topics and break them down to the expert level. Just like PaddleFit Core this is not going to be only a name change from Level 3. While many of the components from PaddleFit Level 3 will be included , PaddleFit Core is a full emersion into the PaddleFit system. PaddleFit Pro summary: â¢ 2 day course â¢ Advanced fitness and training concepts â¢ Advanced technique teaching progression â¢ Both days will be a mixture of interactive presentations as well as skill assessments and practical teaching sessions â¢ Advanced physical testing and technique assessments including the PaddleFit Technique Screenâ¢ â¢ Course will conclude with a comprehensive written exam as well as practical skill assessment

data.name: ZEN.GAâ¢
data.about:
ZEN.GAâ¢ is a synergistic blend of mind-body modalities, supported by exercise science and the newest findings in fascial fitness.  ZEN represents the search for inner discovery, while YOGA symbolizes a pathway to reach it. When applied together, these principles bring awareness of how the body and the mind move in tandem. ZEN.GAâ¢ focuses on core stability, stamina and resilience while attaining a state of presence. The increase in demand on the neuromuscular system affords the benefits of improved strength, enhanced elasticity and creates a more youthful, resilient and fluid body.

Developed by the Merrithew Health & Fitnessâ¢ (MH&F) team, ZEN.GA joins STOTT PILATESÂ® as a new form of mindful exercise. For over 25 years MH&F has been dedicated to building multi-disciplinary fitness brands for people of all ages, levels of fitness and abilities and has become the leaders in mindful movementâ¢.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: The Equipment program created through the ZENâ¢GA approach to movement allow us to utilize the unique quality of spring resistance. The coiling and uncoiling quality of the springs creates a more fluid, resilient body. The ZENâ¢GA Equipment Course will help us explore the principles that make up the method and apply them to movement programs designed to reach the desired goals. This is a seven-hour in-class training (plus one-hour break) - and some previous yoga or other mind-body training is highly recommended.

data.about:
COREâ¢ is an athletic conditioning education method engineered for total body power, strength and agility. This unique training program focuses on functional fitness targeting core strength and kinesthetic awareness leading to improvements in total-body strength and power. This multi-layered system is designed to help retrain unbalanced muscles, initiate the core, and build strength from within that will transfer on and off the playing field! 
COREâ¢ joins STOTT PILATESÂ® as a new form of mindful exercise. For over 25 years MH&F has been dedicated to building multi-disciplinary fitness brands for people of all ages, levels of fitness and abilities and has become the leaders in mindful movementâ¢.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value: This course introduces important concepts of athletic conditioning and performance training and emphasis is placed on utilizing 11 Foundational Principles when training athletes. The principles cover alignment and biomechanics for the major joints involved in athletic performance as well as understanding how to train the three classifications of muscles for optimal performance. In addition, components of athletic conditioning are overviewed including resistance training methods, plyometric training, balance training, and speed & agility training. Performance training concepts such as periodization are also introduced.

data.name: POUND
data.about:
Poundâ¢ is committed to bringing the exhilarating and freeing feeling of listening to and making music to your workout experience while building inner and outer beauty, cultivating self-confidence and gaining empowerment and strength. 

Pound is an aggressive exercise jam session that combines light weight with constant simulated drumming, integrating lightly weighted drumsticks (Ripstix) to activate your core, back and legs in a profound way. 

Pound is currently a 45 minute group fitness class and ACE/AFAA accredited method with a strong network of instructors and classes in LA, New York, Miami and San Francisco. It is widely present at Crunch gyms and is also offerered at specialty studios, dance studios, and for corporate wellness at Sony Pictures and The Grammys.

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Pound Pro training is ACE and AFAA accredited, giving you 5.5 AFAA CEUâs and .5 CEUâs and the immediate ability to teach upon completion. Prior teaching experience and official certifications are NOT required to complete training but are recommended to enhance your marketability as a Pound Pro.

Pound Pro Training is a ONE DAY dynamic, streamlined, and comprehensive training experience. Vastly enhance your resume, skill set and appeal as an individual in the fitness community while learning the in-and-outs of instructing Pound classes at any Pound Venue in just one day. After the training, get brand new Poundtracks every single month to keep your classes fresh, exciting and challenging.

Pound is a 12-song, 45 minute sequence which is built from simple, choreographed tracks. Instructors of all backgrounds excel at teaching our blend of Pilates, Cardio and streamlining Strength Training moves. The series follows a proven sequence that provides familiarity, structure and keeps students engaged and excited to attend classes again and again.

certifications.title: Exercise and Nutritional Sciences, Associate of Science Degree

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Award Description: 
The Associate of Science degree in Exercise and Nutritional Sciences is intended for students who plan to complete a bachelor's degree at a transfer institution in an exercise science, health, or nutrition-related major. Common university majors in this field include:
Exercise Science, Health Sciences/Public Health, Kinesiology, Nutrition and Food Science, Occupational Health, Physical Education, Pre-Physical Therapy. This degree is designed to accommodate the differing requirements of a wide variety of
transfer institutions and major options. Because admission and major preparation requirements vary at each transfer institution, courses used to complete this degree should be selected with the assistance of a Miramar College counselor. The college is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC). This is the same organization that accredits other CCC campuses as well as CSU, UC, and other university campuses (Stanford, USD, USC, etc).

certifications.title: Kinesiology for Transfer, Associates in Arts Degree

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
Program Goals:
The Associate in Arts in Kinesiology for Transfer is intended for students who plan to complete a bachelor's degree in Kinesiology or a related major in the California State University (CSU) system.
 
Students completing this major gain knowledge and skills in the study of kinesiology and human biology, including:
Â·     The basic philosophies, purposes, nature, and scope of Kinesiology as a discipline and as a profession
Â·     The subdisciplines and allied fields within Kinesiology
Â·     Recommended guidelines for physical activity and nutrition
Â·     Human body structure from the microscopic level of organization to the gross level
Â·     Human body functions, including but not limited to muscular, cardiovascular, and respiratory systems
Â·     The principles and practices of physical fitness and sports activities.
 
Students also select from several supporting courses that are related to the field of Kinesiology and/or articulated to major preparation requirements for the Kinesiology major at a CSU campus. The supporting courses provide breadth of experience in supporting interdisciplinary subject areas. The college is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC). This is the same organization that accredits other CCC campuses as well as CSU, UC, and other university campuses (Stanford, USD, USC, etc).

attrs.label: Description
attrs.value:
A 9-course, 19 unit college certification program for personal trainers.  The program includes 264 lecture hours and 136 hands-on, practical lab hours making it one of the most thorough personal trainer certification programs in the country.

The courses include: Applied Exercise Physiology, Applied Kinesiology, Techniques of Weight Training, Training Principles for Special Populations, Techniques of Exercise Leadership, Exercise and Fitness Assessment, Nutrition for Fitness and Sports, Care and Prevention of Injuries & the Internship for Fitness Specialists course.

Unlike other certification programs all of the courses are taught by qualified college professors in state-of-the-art classrooms with the hands-on portion in a brand new fitness center and athletic training room.  Internship opportunities as a strength coach for the college's athletic teams and personal training in the fitness center are also available.

The college program is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC). This is the same organization that accredits other CCC campuses as well as CSU, UC, and other university campuses (Stanford, USD, USC, etc).
Sports & Fitness Insurance Corporation accepts the Miramar Certificate Program as one of their approved certificates for liability insurance:  http://www.sportsfitness.com/professionals/

attrs.value: Exercise Physiology, Life & Wellness Coaching, Mind Body, Nutrition, Personal Trainer, Special Populations, Sports Conditioning

data.name: Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts
data.about:
Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts: Advanced Martial Arts Training.

The National College of Exercise Professionals-Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer Certification Program is endorsed by the Commissioner of MMA for the State of Hawaii and by the United States Military.

A national MMA trainer certification that is great for personal trainers who want to learn how to train MMA athletes, martial arts instructors who want to add MMA conditioning to their school curriculum or any one who wants to learn how to train in this dynamic sport.

Topics include: *MMA Strength and Conditioning, *MMA training techniques, *fight strategies, *functional training, *athletic skills training, *core and balance training, *performance enhancement training and *professional skills to achieve success as an MMA trainer.

Based on the fitness science curriculum of the leader in exercise professionals - NCEP! And the MMA training methods of some of the best instructors in the world, including Leo Fong (Bruce Lee's close friend and training partner), Gene Lebell (the Godfather of Grappling), the Machado Brothers (Pioneers of Brazilian Jujitsu), and Greg Jackson (top MMA instructor).

The NCEP - Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer program has been endorsed by the Commissioner of MMA for the State of Hawaii and by the United States Military Veterans Administration as an educational program to develop MMA Trainers and future leaders in the sport and the MMA Industry.

Graduates of the NCEP - Rainbow Warrior Martial Arts MMA Trainer Certification program will be certified as a National College of Exercise Professionals Personal Trainer, a Strength and Conditioning Coach for MMA and a Rainbow Warrior MMA Trainer/Coach for the sport of Mixed Martial Arts. The program includes almost 50 hours of training and education curriculum for the cost of $1000.

To register or for more information call: (310) 430-3664
